Frequently Asked Questions

How many websites use WordPress in 2025?

WordPress powers over 541 million websites globally, representing 43.4% of all websites on the internet as of 2025.

What is WordPress's market share in the CMS industry?

WordPress commands 60.8% of the identifiable CMS market share, outperforming all competitors combined.

How big is the WordPress economy?

The WordPress economy was valued at $596.7 billion in 2020, with projections exceeding $636 billion in 2021 and expected to surpass $700 billion by 2030.

How many WordPress plugins are available?

There are over 59,000 free plugins in the official WordPress repository and more than 70,000 total plugins including premium options.

Is WordPress good for enterprise websites?

Yes, 14.7% of the top 100 websites use WordPress, including major enterprises like CNN, Microsoft, Bloomberg, and Sony Music. WordPress offers enterprise-grade scalability, security, and flexibility.

How many languages is WordPress available in?

WordPress is available in more than 208 languages, making it truly global and accessible to users worldwide.

What is WordCamp?

WordCamps are community-organized conferences focusing on WordPress. There have been 1,236 WordCamps held across 65 countries, offering affordable tickets ($20-40) and covering everything from beginner to advanced WordPress topics.

How many people contribute to WordPress?

The WordPress community has 100,000-500,000 active contributors. For example, 924 individuals contributed to the WordPress 6.8 core release alone.

Is WordPress free?

Yes, WordPress core software is completely free and open-source. However, you'll need to pay for web hosting, and may choose to purchase premium themes, plugins, or services.

What's the future of WordPress?

WordPress is expected to continue growing, with market share potentially reaching 50% by 2030. Key trends include block editor evolution, headless WordPress, AI integration, performance optimization, and increased enterprise adoption.
